featured.text: If you are traveling, reserve seats where motion is felt the least, such as the front row of a car or forward cars of a train.
They performed poorly at a detailed activity __(30)__ arranging a row of beads.
They had rowed nearly 5,500 miles when their boat was hit by a fishing ship on September 17, 2001.
They made a plan to row across the Pacific Ocean from Japan to San Francisco.

definition.zh_def: 一排或一行的物體或人，通常是直線排列的。
definition.en_def: A linear arrangement of objects or people, typically in a straight line.
definition.example: The students stood in a row for the class photo.
